column4: Help, I'm trying to set up an eggdrop, what TCL package should I install?
you should just install the 'eggdrop' package
yep, in universe
forget about "tcl", there is no such package.  Installing "eggdrop" will pull in everything you need
it won't install cause of that
pastebin the output of 'sudo aptitude install eggdrop'
I wasn't paying attention, and typed tcl -.-
ah :)
where does it install to?
shouldn't matter, but 'dpkg -L eggdrop' tells you where everything went
all I have is a "modules" folder...
type 'eggdrop' (and then it will tell you it wants the config file you create)
you create it.  There's probably an example one in /usr/share/doc/eggdrop/ but there are a lot of websites that will generate one too if you search
what file should I put it in? /usr/lib/eggdrop?
I don't think it matters, you just specify the path.  I've never used eggdrop though
how can I find eggdrop file?
you need to create one
with the settings you want.  Google for 'eggdrop configuration', there are several websites that generate one.  Also, you may want to try #eggdrop
know any sites off the top of your head that generate a conf file for it?
I don't use any, so I can't recommend them.  Try googling 'eggdrop generate conf'
may I PM you, or can we join a seperate channel?
/join #ubuntu-classroom
